title: 106_hr1022
content:
The Act titled "Y2K State and Local Government Assistance Programs Act" authorizes the Secretary of Commerce to provide grants to States for specific activities outlined in the Act. Grants must be issued within a 2-year period from the enactment date, with limitations on the number of grants per State and overall. The Y2K Compliance Project under the Act requires grant recipients to make information technology Y2K compliant, supplement funds, and meet Secretary-prescribed requirements. Matching requirements mandate recipients to supplement grant amounts received. The Act requires grant recipients to supplement grant amounts with funds from other sources, including donated materials, building leases, and staff salaries for Y2K compliance projects. The Secretary may waive the matching requirement for states facing undue hardship. The Secretary will award grants based on competitive criteria, prioritizing projects related to Y2K compliance in federal welfare programs. The Secretary may grant funds to a State if the application meets specific requirements, including submission through the state executive office within 45 days of the Act's enactment, a project description with a budget and funding request, a plan for meeting matching requirements, and other necessary information. The application must include all required information, assurances, and certifications as specified by the Secretary. SEC. 6. REPORTS.

Each grant recipient must submit an annual report to the Secretary detailing the Y2K compliance project, including an independent evaluation and any additional information requested. The Secretary must also submit a final report to Congress within 90 days after the 2-year period from the enactment of this Act.

SEC. 7. DEFINITIONS. The definitions under this Act include the Secretary of Commerce, the various States and territories of the United States, and welfare programs such as TANF and Medicaid. The definitions under this Act include various welfare programs such as food stamps, WIC, child support enforcement, and child welfare programs. The term "Y2K compliant" refers to information technology that accurately processes date and time data between the 20th and 21st centuries, including leap year calculations. The Secretary will issue regulations to implement the Act. $40,000,000 is authorized for fiscal years 1999 to 2001 from Y2K Emergency Supplemental Funds.
